name: paper-dialog
description:
Material Design: Dialogs `paper-dialog` is an overlay with a drop shadow. Example:

Some content

 Styling ------- Because a `paper-dialog` is `layered` by default, you need to use the `/deep/` combinator to style all instances of the `paper-dialog`. Style the position, colors and other inherited properties of the dialog using the `html /deep/ paper-dialog` selector. Use the `html /deep/ paper-dialog::shadow #scroller` selector to size the dialog. Note that if you provided actions, the height of the actions will be added to the height of the dialog. html /deep/ paper-dialog { color: green; } html /deep/ paper-dialog::shadow #scroller { height: 300px; width: 300px; } Transitions ----------- You can use transitions provided by `core-transition` with this element.

Some content

 Accessibility ------------- By default, the `aria-label` will be set to the value of the `heading` attribute.

methods.name: notifyResize
methods.description: User should call when resizing or un-hiding children

methods.name: resizeerShouldNotify
methods.description:
User should implement to introduce filtering when notifying children.
Generally, children that are hidden by the CoreResizer (e.g. non-active
pages) need not be notified during resize, since they will be notified
again when becoming un-hidden.

Return `true` if CoreResizable passed as argument should be notified of
resize.

methods.name: toggle
methods.description: Toggle the opened state of the overlay.

methods.name: open
methods.description:
Open the overlay. This is equivalent to setting the `opened`
property to true.

methods.name: close
methods.description:
Close the overlay. This is equivalent to setting the `opened` 
property to false.

methods.name: resizeHandler
methods.description:
Extensions of core-overlay should implement the `resizeHandler`
method to adjust the size and position of the overlay when the 
browser window resizes.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
The target element that will be shown when the overlay is 
opened. If unspecified, the core-overlay itself is the target.

attributes.name: sizingTarget
attributes.description:
A `core-overlay`'s size is guaranteed to be 
constrained to the window size. To achieve this, the sizingElement
is sized with a max-height/width. By default this element is the 
target element, but it can be specifically set to a specific element
inside the target if that is more appropriate. This is useful, for 
example, when a region inside the overlay should scroll if needed.

attributes.name: opened
attributes.description:
Set opened to true to show an overlay and to false to hide it.
A `core-overlay` may be made initially opened by setting its
`opened` attribute.

attributes.name: backdrop
attributes.description:
If true, the overlay has a backdrop darkening the rest of the screen.
The backdrop element is attached to the document body and may be styled
with the class `core-overlay-backdrop`. When opened the `core-opened`
class is applied.

attributes.name: layered
attributes.description: If true, the overlay is guaranteed to display above page content.

attributes.name: autoCloseDisabled
attributes.description:
By default an overlay will close automatically if the user
taps outside it or presses the escape key. Disable this
behavior by setting the `autoCloseDisabled` property to true.

attributes.name: autoFocusDisabled
attributes.description:
By default an overlay will focus its target or an element inside
it with the `autoFocus` attribute. Disable this
behavior by setting the `autoFocusDisabled` property to true.

attributes.name: closeAttribute
attributes.description:
This property specifies an attribute on elements that should
close the overlay on tap. Should not set `closeSelector` if this
is set.

attributes.name: closeSelector
attributes.description:
This property specifies a selector matching elements that should
close the overlay on tap. Should not set `closeAttribute` if this
is set.

attributes.name: transition
attributes.description: The transition property specifies a string which identifies a `core-transition` element that will be used to help the overlay open and close. The default `core-transition-fade` will cause the overlay to fade in and out.

events.name: core-overlay-open-completed
events.description: Fired when the `core-overlay` has completely opened.

events.name: core-overlay-close-completed
events.description: Fired when the `core-overlay` has completely closed.

events.name: core-overlay-position
events.description:
Fired when the `core-overlay` needs to position itself. Optionally, implement
in order to position an overlay via code. If the overlay was not otherwise
positioned, it's important to indicate how the overlay has been positioned by
setting the `dimensions.position` object. For example, if the overlay has been
positioned via setting `right` and `top`, set dimensions.position to an
object like this: `{v: 'top', h: 'right'}`.

properties.name: resizerIsPeer
properties.description:
Set to `true` if the resizer is actually a peer to the elements it
resizes (e.g. splitter); in this case it will listen for resize requests
events from its peers on its parent.
